update.description:
Colcon is happiest when the cmake project name matches the `find_package` name (as mentioned in [this pull request](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/685)). To support this, I added some backwards compatibility variables in the cmake config file that don't have the version number (ie `SDFormat_LIBRARIES`). I also had to adjust the `ign` to `cmd` file.

I also did a little bit of cmake cleanup:

* require cmake 3.10.2 (to match ign-cmake2) and use write_basic_package_version_file
* use `PROJECT_NAME_LOWER` instead of `sdformat${SDF_MAJOR_VERSION}`

UPDATE:

I merged in pull request #476 from @mxgrey  (thank you!) so that cmake targets are now exported. This should fix [ign-sensors issue 3](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-sensors/issues/3/sdformat8-include-directories-not-exported).
update.title: Change cmake project name to sdformat8, export cmake targets

content.raw: I had originally added these three lines in order to create the `SDFormat_*` backwards compatibility variables, but now those are created by the `@PKG_NAME@_*` variables. These lines will create variables that start with `sdformat_`. I think they can be removed.
content.html: I had originally added these three lines in order to create the SDFormat_* backwards compatibility variables, but now those are created by the @PKG_NAME@_* variables. These lines will create variables that start with sdformat_. I think they can be removed.

pullrequest.title: Change cmake project name to sdformat8, export cmake targets

content.raw:
Ah, good catch!

I believe the problem is

    set(sdformat8_PKGCONFIG_TYPE PROJECT_PKGCONFIG_REQUIRES)

should instead be

    set(sdformat8_PKGCONFIG_TYPE PKGCONFIG_REQUIRES)

Notice that `PROJECT_` was removed. This was changed when support for component libraries was added to `ign-cmake`.
content.html:
Ah, good catch!

I believe the problem is

set(sdformat8_PKGCONFIG_TYPE PROJECT_PKGCONFIG_REQUIRES)

should instead be

set(sdformat8_PKGCONFIG_TYPE PKGCONFIG_REQUIRES)

Notice that PROJECT_ was removed. This was changed when support for component libraries was added to ign-cmake.

pullrequest.title: Change cmake project name to sdformat8, export cmake targets

content.raw: We can either use the `PKGCONFIG` argument of `ign_find_package(~)` in `ign-sensors` or we could set `sdformat8_PKGCONFIG_ENTRY` and `sdformat8_PKGCONFIG_TYPE` variables in `sdformat8-config.cmake`. Either would work just fine, but the latter would transfer over to all ignition libraries that depend on `sdformat8`.
content.html: We can either use the PKGCONFIG argument of ign_find_package(~) in ign-sensors or we could set sdformat8_PKGCONFIG_ENTRY and sdformat8_PKGCONFIG_TYPE variables in sdformat8-config.cmake. Either would work just fine, but the latter would transfer over to all ignition libraries that depend on sdformat8.

pull_request.title: Change cmake project name to sdformat8, export cmake targets

pullrequest.title: Change cmake project name to sdformat8, export cmake targets

content.raw:
One thing to note is that `SDFormat_LIBRARIES` still just refers to the library file paths. This is in contrast to the ignition `_LIBRARIES` variables, e.g. `IGNITION-MATH_LIBRARIES` which refer to the imported target. You need to explicitly refer to `sdformat8::sdformat8` to link to the imported target.

I wouldn't be opposed to changing the old `SDFormat_LIBRARIES` variable to match the ignition libraries or introducing a `sdformat8_LIBRARIES` variable that refers to the imported target. But I refrained from doing that in order to minimize the changes to SDFormat's behavior; I feel like it makes more sense to leave big changes until we roll out `ign-sdformat`.
content.html:
One thing to note is that SDFormat_LIBRARIES still just refers to the library file paths. This is in contrast to the ignition _LIBRARIES variables, e.g. IGNITION-MATH_LIBRARIES which refer to the imported target. You need to explicitly refer to sdformat8::sdformat8 to link to the imported target.

I wouldn't be opposed to changing the old SDFormat_LIBRARIES variable to match the ignition libraries or introducing a sdformat8_LIBRARIES variable that refers to the imported target. But I refrained from doing that in order to minimize the changes to SDFormat's behavior; I feel like it makes more sense to leave big changes until we roll out ign-sdformat.

content.raw:
It looks like `colcon` can now correctly find the dependencies:

    # colcon list -g
    OGRE                 +*..........
    ignition-cmake2       +***.******
    ignition-math6         +*****.***
    ignition-common3        +  ** *.*
    ignition-msgs3           +   ** .
    sdformat8                 +    **
    ignition-plugin1           +  ***
    ignition-rendering1         + * .
    ignition-transport6          +* *
    ignition-gui1                 + *
    ignition-physics1              +*
    ignition-gazebo                 +
content.html:
It looks like colcon can now correctly find the dependencies:

# colcon list -g
OGRE                 +*..........
ignition-cmake2       +***.******
ignition-math6         +*****.***
ignition-common3        +  ** *.*
ignition-msgs3           +   ** .
sdformat8                 +    **
ignition-plugin1           +  ***
ignition-rendering1         + * .
ignition-transport6          +* *
ignition-gui1                 + *
ignition-physics1              +*
ignition-gazebo                 +
